resources.string: - Snakelike body\n - Undershot mouth.\n - Dorsal (back) and anal fins are fused with the tail fin forming a single ribbon running along much of the body..
- The body shows a number of dark vertical bands\n - Two back fins that are clearly separate.\n - A black spot can be seen in the back end of the frontal back fin.
- A high backed body, flattened at the sides.\n - The diameter of the eye is smaller than the distance between eye and mouth.\n - Slightly undershot mouth that can be extended
- Mouth positioned straight at end\n - The eye has a red spot in the upper half\n - Front of the back fin and bellyfin are positioned in line.
- 2-4 spines are positioned in front of the back fin.\n - Back and anal fin are postioned at the back of the body.\n - Males in the breeding season have a red throat and belly and blue eyes.
- Big, broad head with swollen cheeks and lips. Undershot mouth.\n - Belly fins have merged into a sucker.\n - Red and brown marble pattern on body and head.

- 6 short barbels at the mouth, 4 on the upper lip and 2 in the corners of the mouth.\n - The sides show a line of dark brown spots\n - there is a forked spike below the eye that is oriented towards the tail.
- One barbel on the chin\n - 2 back fins that are clearly separate\n - Belly fins are located in front of the breast fins
- The eyes are positioned high in the head\n - The nostrils are short tubes\n - Two separate back fins, of which the hindmost one is fused with the tail fin
- The eyes are positioned high in the head\n - The hindmost back fin and the anal fin slope to the back\n - The fish had a pale colour, light blue gray at the sides with fuzzy dark spots
- The smallest perch like fish, up to 14cm\n - The body, tail and back fin has tiny dark spots\n - Bottom dweller with a preference for deeper water
- The two back fins touch, the hindmost being longer that the front one\n - The operculum (gill) has upright spikes\n - No scales on the thead
- Undershot mouth\n - The front of the back fin is positioned clearly behind the front of the belly fins\n - Bright red fins
- Anal fin and back fin are positioned near the back of the body\n - The head sports a flat and broad mouth\n - The body has golden dots or stripes
- The two back fins are separate\n - The upper jaw extends to behind the eye\n - The operculum (gill) is pointy
- In front of the back fin are 9 to 11 spikes\n - The belly fin is silver\n - Anal fin and back fin are positioned near the back of the body
- The iris of the eye is orange\n - The fins are round in shape\n - The mouth has a small barbel at each corner

- The operculum (gill) often has an dark orange spot, surrounded with a black rim\n - The back fin has a front part with tough spikes and a higher back part\n - The body has a prominent pattern with blueish sides and yellowbrown and red spots
- The front back fin has a black spot in the back\n - The belly fins are grown together into a sucker\n - The hindmost back fin is straight
